image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: New Zealand PM wants defence shakeup, focus on 'traditional' allies
item.description: New Zealand will shakeup its defence forces and "reset" its foreign policy to align with traditional allies, the country's prime minister said Thursday. "The foundation of our foreign policy reset is our collaboration with longstanding partners," Luxon told the Lowy Institute, a foreign policy think tank in Sydney, Australia.

item.title: This city is America’s worst place to live in 2024 - Here's why
item.description: In a recent poll by Clever, Washington, DC was ranked as the least desirable city in the US due to high living costs and rising crime rates. About 33 per cent of respondents placed it among their top five least desirable cities, while cities like New York and Los Angeles were also ranked low. Tampa, Florida, topped the desirability ranking for 2024.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Harris edges out Biden in climate confidence among Democrats: Poll

item.title: Meghan Markle rumoured to be planning explosive tell-all memoir
item.description: Meghan Markle is reportedly considering a revealing memoir to share her experiences with the royal family amid rising tensions. This speculation follows Prince Harry's 2023 memoir and recent CBS interview. Sources claim Meghan feels pressured to 'take the gloves off' and provide her perspective, potentially making a significant financial impact and answering public questions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Oops! JD Vance’s speech flops with $50,000 car gaffe and secretary mix-up, draws criticism; watch video
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Japan set to lift 'megaquake' warning
item.description: Japan lifted a week-old alert about a potential 'megaquake' that could cause enormous damage and casualties. The warning had led to panic buying and holiday cancellations. The Japan Meteorological Association issued the caution following a magnitude 7.1 quake. Despite lifting the alert, officials stressed the ongoing risk and urged regular preparedness checks.

item.title: Barron Trump’s impact: The $80 million fortune and social media strategy shaping US 2024 campaign
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Will JD Vance and Tim Walz debate? All you need to know
item.description: A vice-presidential debate between Republican JD Vance and Democrat Tim Walz remains uncertain. CBS News proposed four dates, but Vance has not confirmed participation, citing conditions like a live audience. With the election nearing, both candidates have shown interest in debates. Walz is eager, but scheduling and conditions are still under discussion.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Japan's first-ever megaquake advisory: What does it mean?
item.description: Japan issued its first "megaquake advisory" after a 7.1 magnitude earthquake hit Kyushu's southeastern coast on August 8. Concerned about possible stronger quakes in the Nankai Trough, the government and public are urged to brace for future seismic activity. Prime Minister Fumio Kishida cancelled his trip to address the situation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections: Is Kamala Harris trying to distance herself from Biden? Critics call campaign 'fake'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris surges ahead of Trump in 6 of 7 battleground states
item.description: A recent series of polls indicated that Vice President Kamala Harris showed strong momentum against former President Donald Trump in key battleground states. The surveys revealed that Harris led in most states, except for Nevada. The Cook Political Report noted Harris's lead has increased since May, highlighting her competitive edge.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Uncertain future for ISS astronauts Wilmore and Williams: Nasa weighs SpaceX vs Boeing Starliner
item.description: NASA remains undecided on whether to keep astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams at the ISS due to issues with Boeing's Starliner capsule. The astronauts might extend their stay until February 2025, potentially returning aboard SpaceX's Dragon. Boeing faced setbacks during the mission, including thruster malfunctions and helium leaks, prompting further tests in space.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Google celebrates India's Independence Day with this special Doodle
item.description: On India's 78th Independence Day, Google featured a doodle by Vrinda Zaveri, celebrating iconic Indian architecture adorned in national colors. The doodle honored freedom fighters and highlighted Independence Day celebrations, including flag-raising ceremonies and cultural events. Google offered best wishes to the nation, continuing its tradition of creating special doodles for significant global occasions.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Will Prince Harry and Meghan Markle’s Sussexes titles survive? 'The Balmoral gathering isn’t just a summer holiday,' insider warns
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: High-stakes talks in Doha: Can US and Middle Eastern allies secure Gaza Hostage release and ceasefire?
item.description: Senior officials from the US, Qatar, Egypt, and Israel met in Doha for crucial discussions to finalize a hostage release and ceasefire agreement for Gaza. The gathered leaders sought to de-escalate Middle Eastern tensions and avert a larger regional conflict, amid threats from Iran and Hezbollah. President Biden viewed the agreement as critical to reducing broader war risks.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ukraine says advance into Russia 'going well': New evacuation hotline and military strikes highlight escalation
item.description: Ukraine's forces advanced in Russia's Kursk region, creating a buffer zone to protect Ukraine's borders. President Zelenskyy announced plans for military commandant offices, and a hotline for residents wishing to evacuate to Ukraine. Meanwhile, Russia ordered evacuations in response but struggled to dislodge Ukrainian troops, despite President Putin's vows.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US Navy unveils longest-range missile: Will AIM-174B be a game-changer in Indo-Pacific tensions?
item.description: The US Navy deployed the AIM-174B long-range air-to-air missile in the Indo-Pacific to counter China's aerial supremacy. This missile, operational since July, significantly extends reach compared to previous missiles. It allows US jets to keep Chinese threats at bay, protect key assets, and strike high-value targets from afar, altering the strategic balance in the region.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
